abstract: Inexperienced employees and a lack of organization led to chaos in the foreclosure process at many lenders.
snippet: Inexperienced employees and a lack of organization led to chaos in the foreclosure process at many lenders.
lead_paragraph: At JPMorgan Chase, they were derided as “Burger King kids” — walk-in hires who were so inexperienced they barely knew what a mortgage was, Eric Dash and Nelson D. Schwartz write in The New York Times.

headline.main: Bankers Ignored Signs of Trouble on Foreclosures

abstract: While media reports about a potential AOL-private equity deal for Yahoo have deal-makers chattering, the truth is that any sale is far down the road.
snippet: While media reports about a potential AOL-private equity deal for Yahoo have deal-makers chattering, the truth is that any sale is far down the road.
lead_paragraph: The deal chatter Thursday morning is centering on reports by All Things D and The Wall Street Journal that buyout firms are contemplating teaming up with AOL or the News Corporation to buy Yahoo. (Shares in Yahoo jumped nearly 15.8 percent in after-hours trading to $15.25.)

headline.main: A Sale of Yahoo? Not So Fast
